alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Limestone County through 645 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a nearly staionary strong thunderstorm over Tanner. One to two inches of rainfall has already fallen and an additional inch of rainfall is possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall producing ponding of water on area roadways. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Decatur, Athens, and Tanner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
